products: YourCareCommunity Patient Portal with YourCareEverywhere App

access.notes: EHI section is at #EHIExport anchor on the interoperability marketing page. Content is server-rendered HTML despite WP Rocket lazy-loading. Developer portal at yourcareinteract.medhost.com requires browser (Angular SPA) but Swagger JSON is directly downloadable.

export_format.description: EHI Export generates multiple NDJSON files per patient using FHIR R4 v4.0.1 as a guideline, with MEDHOST-specific extension fields for data not covered by standard FHIR. Files are delivered as a compressed ZIP file.

documentation.table_or_resource_count_detail: 41 resource types with MEDHOST-specific extension fields documented in XLSX, plus 30 standard FHIR resource types in Swagger spec
documentation.notes: The XLSX documents 708 extension fields across 41 FHIR resource types. Each field has: name, version, FHIR field type, max length, description, and internal database table/column mappings for Enterprise and EDIS systems. The base FHIR R4 fields are implied (via the FHIR R4 standard) but not individually documented by MEDHOST.

clinical.evidence: AllergyIntolerance, Condition, DiagnosticReport, Immunization, MedicationAdministration, MedicationRequest, MedicationStatement, Observation (Labs, Vitals), Procedure (104 extension fields), Problem, Smoking Status, Family Member History, Goal, CarePlan resources

secure_messages.evidence: Searched for message/inbox/communication/chat/portal/secure/correspondence across all XLSX sheets and swagger definitions. Only found MedicationRequest-Prescriptions/message-type and message-id (e-prescribing message tracking, not patient messaging). No dedicated secure messaging or patient-provider communication resource documented.

billing_financial.evidence: ChargeItem resource with 19 extension fields including primary/secondary/tertiary insurance CPT codes. Ancillary Order with billing-G-Code, billing-modifier, billing-system-name. Patient resource includes date-of-last-bill. Appointment includes charges field. Encounter has 102 extension fields including financial/admission data.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Coverage resource with 30 extension fields including authorization-number, authorization-period, authorization-modified-user, authorization-modified-date, employer details, guarantor info. ChargeItem has primary/secondary/tertiary insurance CPT code fields.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: Appointment resource with 20 extension fields including charges, reschedule-by, reschedule-comment, reschedule-requested-reason, deleted-date, appointment-question-code, no-show-code, arrival fields.

documents_images.evidence: DocumentReference is in the FHIR API swagger spec (30 model definitions). However, no MEDHOST-specific extension fields documented for DocumentReference in the XLSX. Standard FHIR DocumentReference would carry document metadata and content.

audit_trails.evidence: No dedicated audit trail resource. Many resources include modification tracking fields (modified-reason, modified-comment, modified-by, modified-date) and reconciliation tracking, but there is no comprehensive audit log resource documenting who accessed/viewed records. Provenance resource exists in the API but has no MEDHOST extensions.

fhir_resources_in_export: Observation (multiple subtypes: Alcohol Use, Drug Use, Education, General Comment, Labs, Marital Status, Occupation, Sexual Behavior, Travel)
developer_guide_detail: Developer portal at yourcareinteract.medhost.com with Technical Guide for App Developers covering signup, authentication (SMART-on-FHIR, OAuth 2.0), sandbox apps, and API access. Data Export section describes Group Export process via FHIR Bulk Data.
sandbox_detail: Developer portal mentions Sandbox Apps section for testing
issues: No standalone EHI export documentation page — content is a section on a marketing page
The XLSX only documents MEDHOST-specific extension fields, not the complete FHIR resource schemas — the base FHIR R4 fields are implied but not vendor-documented
System and Patient Export are stated as 'not supported through FHIR API' on the developer portal — unclear what the actual export mechanism is for these modes
No secure messaging/patient communication resource documented in the export
No comprehensive audit trail resource in the export
No sample export files or example NDJSON output provided
Release date field in XLSX Main sheet is blank
summary: MEDHOST documents their EHI export as FHIR R4-based NDJSON files delivered in a ZIP archive. The primary documentation artifact is an XLSX file with 41 tabs documenting 708 extension fields that MEDHOST adds to standard FHIR R4 resources, including internal database column mappings. The export covers clinical data, billing (ChargeItem with CPT codes), insurance (Coverage with 30 fields), appointments, and procedures extensively. Notable gaps: no secure messaging resource, no audit trail resource, and no sample exports. The documentation approach is unusual — rather than documenting the full export schema, they document only their extensions to FHIR R4, expecting consumers to reference the FHIR R4 spec for base fields.
